Manager

class utils.manager.Manager

Manager handles three things:

  1. intializing config _post_init_config_from_hydra();

  2. preparing dataloader prepare();

  3. train models train();

config

the configuration of the models, indexes etc.

Type

dict

_set_seed(seed: Optional[int] = None)

Set random seed

_set_plm(plm: Optional[str] = None)

Load plm and plm related parameters; download plm there isn’t one. One may add a new plm into the plm_map object so that Manager knows how to download it (load_name) and where to store it cache files (tokenizer).

special_token_ids

stores the token and token_id of each special tokens

Type

Dict[Tuple]

_post_init_config_from_hydra(config: omegaconf.omegaconf.OmegaConf)

Initialize config object from the OmegaConf from hydra (flatten it by utils.util.flatten_dict()); add some dataset-specific or mode-specific config customization.

Parameters

config – parsed by hydra from command line, the available configs are in the data/config directory

setup(rank: int)

Set up distributed training/evaluating by nccl backend.

Parameters

rank – current process id

synchronize()

Synchronize all processes in distribution mode by barrier().

cleanup()

Destropy the process group of distrbution.

prepare() → dict[str, torch.utils.data.DataLoader]

Prepare dataloader for training/evaluating.

Returns

train: dataloader for trianing; including neg/triple/triple-raw…

text: dataloader for text corpus if config.loader_text is not none;

query: dataloader for query in eval_set if config.loader_eval is retrieve;

rerank: dataloader for rerank if config.loader_eval is rerank;

Return type

dict[str, DataLoader]

_train(model: torch.nn.Module, loaders: dict[str, torch.utils.data.DataLoader], optimizer, scheduler)

Low level wrap up for training. Evaluate the model by config.eval_mode every config.eval_step. Save the best performance checkpoint in data/cache/config.dataset/ckpts/model_name/best.

Parameters

  • model –

  • loaders – returned by prepare()

  • optimizer (nn.optim) – returned by _get_optimizer()

  • scheduler (nn.scheduler) – returned by _get_optimizer()

train(model: torch.nn.Module, loaders: dict[str, torch.utils.data.DataLoader])

train the model

Parameters

  • model –

  • loaders – returned by prepare()
